subject: Prevent error when duplicate mapping is created
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-07-18 09:39:10.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/mapping_backends/sql.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_id_mapping_sql.py'], 'message': 'Prevent error when duplicate mapping is created

The mapping has unique constraint and creating a mapping with the same
local entity will fail. Creation of mapping with the same local entity
might happen because of race condition, that would happen if 2 processes
start mapping of the same local entity at the same time.

Return the existing public_id if creation failed due to duplicate.

Change-Id: Ic6e6ec9614e16a49c791dc6c06a4464d18be09be
Related-Bug: 1582585
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent error when duplicate mapping is created

The mapping has unique constraint and creating a mapping with the same
local entity will fail. Creation of mapping with the same local entity
might happen because of race condition, that would happen if 2 processes
start mapping of the same local entity at the same time.

Return the existing public_id if creation failed due to duplicate.

Change-Id: Ic6e6ec9614e16a49c791dc6c06a4464d18be09be
Related-Bug: 1582585

revisions:

This introduces a new keystone-manage command called 'doctor' which
attempts to diagnose and report on various ill-advised configurations
and deployment states.

The number of checks we could perform is basically endless, so this is
just a random sampling of checks to get the ball rolling. The idea is
that as new features are introduced, as default configurations change,
as we have new recommendations to make to deployers, etc, we can
implement new checks in keystone-manage doctor and communicate our

Change-Id: Ib6660c1a885c439ca03357870628b2ea52e39e9d
Implements: bp keystone-manage-doctor
"}]
commit_message:
keystone-manage doctor

This introduces a new keystone-manage command called 'doctor' which
attempts to diagnose and report on various ill-advised configurations
and deployment states.

The number of checks we could perform is basically endless, so this is
just a random sampling of checks to get the ball rolling. The idea is
that as new features are introduced, as default configurations change,
as we have new recommendations to make to deployers, etc, we can
implement new checks in keystone-manage doctor and communicate our
concerns directly to those operated affected deployments.

Change-Id: Ib6660c1a885c439ca03357870628b2ea52e39e9d
Implements: bp keystone-manage-doctor

commit_message:
rename a file for fedora guests

fedora guests don't use upstart. renaming the file because the current
name (20-guest-upstart) while identical to the name for the ubuntu
file is confusing and misleading.

Change-Id: I9818235e0d367c8213ccd1f60c4b26be11dd3735

commit_message:
Fix the bug of 'AttributeError' when connect volume

Since 'ISCSIConnector' object has no attribute 'host_device', we
can use the parameter 'device_name' instead when we can't find a
multipath device.

Change-Id: I17eef252e127f9741883778a622d4666cd348cd1
Closes-Bug: #1593643

subject: Git mv'd all bootstrap dir files into services dir
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-07-19 20:55:07.000000000', 'files': ['services/mariadb/mariadb-pvc.yml.j2', 'services/glance/glance-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'services/neutron/neutron-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'etc/kolla-kubernetes/service_resources.yml', 'services/keystone/keystone-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'services/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'services/mariadb/mariadb-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'services/nova/nova-compute-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'setup.cfg', 'services/mariadb/mariadb-pv.yml.j2', 'services/nova/nova-control-bootstrap-job.yml.j2', 'services/mariadb/mariadb-disk.sh.j2'], 'message': "Git mv'd all bootstrap dir files into services dir

- No bug-fixes, blue-prints, nor code changes.
- Originally, kolla-kubernetes only used 3 types of kubernetes
resource files (job, pod, svc).  Bootstrap files (job) were separated
from service files (pod, svc).  Subcommands were tied directly to the
files their respective directories (bootstrap command -> ./bootstrap
dir, run command -> ./services dir).
- This was done because of the way kolla-kubernetes used to work.
Upon subcommand launch, all of the files in its respective
directory were jinja processed and then loaded into kubernetes (in
random order).
- Now that we have added a bunch of resources that require ordering
(disk, pv, pvc, etc), and kolla-kubernetes directly references each
type of file based on the configuration of
./etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml, we no longer need to
separate bootstrap and service files.

Change-Id: I595388a686330cfdeb662b9a0a8b52cc1d45c913
"}]
commit_message:
Git mv'd all bootstrap dir files into services dir

- No bug-fixes, blue-prints, nor code changes.
- Originally, kolla-kubernetes only used 3 types of kubernetes
resource files (job, pod, svc).  Bootstrap files (job) were separated
from service files (pod, svc).  Subcommands were tied directly to the
files their respective directories (bootstrap command -> ./bootstrap
dir, run command -> ./services dir).
- This was done because of the way kolla-kubernetes used to work.
Upon subcommand launch, all of the files in its respective
directory were jinja processed and then loaded into kubernetes (in
random order).
- Now that we have added a bunch of resources that require ordering
(disk, pv, pvc, etc), and kolla-kubernetes directly references each
type of file based on the configuration of
./etc/kolla-kubernetes/kolla-kubernetes.yml, we no longer need to
separate bootstrap and service files.

Change-Id: I595388a686330cfdeb662b9a0a8b52cc1d45c913

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 18:44:40.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "sqlalchemy: fix JSONEncodedDict implementation type

Change-Id: I5f5d7902c647ba0b7a214bca21d0df1cc96fc57c
"}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy: fix JSONEncodedDict implementation type

It's actually Text, not String, as correctly written in migration
scripts.

This fixes an error on MySQL as String is converted to VARCHAR which
requires a length.

Change-Id: I5f5d7902c647ba0b7a214bca21d0df1cc96fc57c

commit_message:
Use bundletester for amulet test execution

Switch to using bundletester for execution of functional tests,
leveraging tox to build out test virtualenvs.

Rename amulet tests inline with gate-*, dev-* and dfs-*
naming standards.

Update README to refer to functional testing section of the charm
guide.

commit_message:
Implement Date Filters for Secrets

This CR implements the spec for date filters.  The only difference
between the spec and this CR is the use of the alternative ISO format
(without the "Z") for specifying the dates.  This change was made to
have a more consistent API since the Zulu designation is not used
anywhere in the API where dates are shown to the user.  Additionaly the
libraries used for date-time parsing do not make use of the Zulu
designation either.

Implements: blueprint date-filters
DocImpact
APIImpact

Change-Id: Ic8fbe3d0e8b309bb192aaddf30291d1333756064

commit_message:
Add block_device_mappings to BuildRequest

Due to the os-extended-volumes API it is necessary to be able to
retrieve block device mapping info for an instance at any time. In order
to do so it needs to be stored with the build request.

This also makes it available during instance deletion where it may be
useful to look up whether delete_on_termination is set on a bdm so that
it can be cleaned up.

Change-Id: Ib774a43e49b7153b3f7b099a59483c62003ee7a8
Partially-Implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj

commit_message:
Fix wrong exception return in fixed_ips v2 extention

This kind of revert commit 378681490b043a5a51a9f58fba138310c20ea235.

The general idea for this revert is that the current code exposes which
SQL database is backing Nova. If Postgre, a HTTPBadRequest can be
raised, whilst with MySQL only a HTTPNotFound can be raised. We don't
want the API to depend on which SQL server is used.

This bug was already fixed by I9aa14bea2f29f1df85dfd1f07eb0b1947d2c1100
and I83d532c28c9aec690e8e1ffad8b58e71d619d728 but
I7b18b76745f9092456d511ad023a9ed3a24cca84 introduced the regression.

Changing the returned status code back and forth got unoticed by Tempest
because of the change Iafd2fb82ad5d50c2f4b3f0819ac7a6f8aa901264

Change-Id: I191b626a471626f334e4835fab602acea505ff78

commit_message:
libvirt: Rollback on dest host after deleting vm during live migration

If the VM is deleted during live migration process, there are remaining
garbage on destination host. This patch improves live_migration_monitor
to handle 'deletion process during live migration' by calling proper
rollback. This functionality are also covered by unit tests.

Change-Id: I6dcdb5ece512d074ff25aa9f6313c7b759d8a73a
Closes-Bug: #1285000

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-08 18:15:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cache_utils.py', 'nova/api/metadata/handler.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1549814-0801c7887523d9ab.yaml'], 'message': 'Don't use memcached for caching metadata for now

The caching backend for memcached/dogpile stores whole Python objects
by creating a deep copy.  At the moment Metadata is cached by storing
the metadata Python object, and therefore the whole object tree
underneath, including the "instance" attribute.  Whenever the
metadata is fetched, it also fetches the old version of instance with
it, and works on it.  This has several implications, like for example
lazy fetched fields of the "instance" object are never cached, if
they are not pre-fetched before caching.  Also it might implicate
security issues.  Until this is fixed by correctly caching pure data
structures, this patch forces to use the internal cache (based on a
Python dict), which doesn't have these issues.

BUMP

Change-Id: If853be1693f3673a9392b985b9035e1ada8e2a93
Closes-Bug: #1549814
'}]
commit_message:
Don't use memcached for caching metadata for now

The caching backend for memcached/dogpile stores whole Python objects
by creating a deep copy.  At the moment Metadata is cached by storing
the metadata Python object, and therefore the whole object tree
underneath, including the "instance" attribute.  Whenever the
metadata is fetched, it also fetches the old version of instance with
it, and works on it.  This has several implications, like for example
lazy fetched fields of the "instance" object are never cached, if
they are not pre-fetched before caching.  Also it might implicate
security issues.  Until this is fixed by correctly caching pure data
structures, this patch forces to use the internal cache (based on a
Python dict), which doesn't have these issues.

BUMP

Change-Id: If853be1693f3673a9392b985b9035e1ada8e2a93
Closes-Bug: #1549814

commit_message:
Avoid parallel DB queries of identical metadata

If several metadata request come in, and the data is not in the cache
yet, each of them trigger their own database query.  This patch
synchronizes the metadata access in order to block subsequent
identical cache queries until the cache is populated.

Change-Id: Iafb530e7431bbe95f2e0af51e979649591f95597
Related-Bug: #1549814

commit_message:
VMware: speed up start of n-cpu

When booting a nova-compute node and say for example there are 1024 VMs
running on that node, the node may take upto 2 hours to actually start
to work.

This patch does the instance sync with the DB in the background.

Change-Id: I8fd4e97d327680ecf7aeccaf643850938d61595f
Closes-Bug: #1513735

commit_message:
Libvirt: enable error_policy option for instances

This allows the administrator to set the libvirt driver error_policy
that controls how libvirt handles I/O errors. The administrator may
set the new option 'io_error_policy' in the [libvirt] section to any
of the known error_policy options.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint libvirt-enable-error-policy-option
Change-Id: I6bf43910d74f5069cbf212db8c162115b60c6aba

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-02-01 01:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_shelve.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Move the shutdown_retry_interval to nova.conf

The shutdown_retry_interval is time to wait in seconds before
re-issuing a shutdown signal to an instance during power off.
The overall time to wait is set by CONF.shutdown_timeout.

But the instance shutdown_retry_interval param is defined as a
constant in the ComputeManager class. I think we should move it
to the nova.conf file, so we can config it by ourselves. It will
be set to 10 seconds if the value is bigger than
CONF.shutdown_timeout.

DocImpact

This patch will impact the nova.conf file.

Change-Id: Ib8c4c9d93256ed1707e065e39760ba5034b26545
'}]
commit_message:
Move the shutdown_retry_interval to nova.conf

The shutdown_retry_interval is time to wait in seconds before
re-issuing a shutdown signal to an instance during power off.
The overall time to wait is set by CONF.shutdown_timeout.

But the instance shutdown_retry_interval param is defined as a
constant in the ComputeManager class. I think we should move it
to the nova.conf file, so we can config it by ourselves. It will
be set to 10 seconds if the value is bigger than
CONF.shutdown_timeout.

DocImpact

This patch will impact the nova.conf file.

Change-Id: Ib8c4c9d93256ed1707e065e39760ba5034b26545

commit_message:
Use constraints for coverage job

OpenStack CI supports now constraints in the coverage job - as a first
job to check that recent changes for zuul-cloner work correctly.

Use constraints for cover environment. If this works successfully, the
other environments can be updated in followups.

Change-Id: I6069bee0a89d38f6a3ec57418e7bda9850dc6f64

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292

commit_message:
Add maxcpus support for qemu/kvm

Currently nova doesn't support cpu hotplug for qemu/kvm, the patch is
to add maxcpus to qemu command line once the hw:max_vcpus is set inside
the extra specs of flavor. By now we're only able to add vcpu to
qemu/kvm's instance via qemu-monitor-command.

The blueprint is
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/add-maxvcpus-flavor-extra-specs

Change-Id: I805652c603eff753fe88fba4414b80cf4ec224c5

Previously we were only setting the mtu on br-ex if not running grenade.
But now neutron runs multinode grenade tests so need to have br-ex's mtu
set appropriately for grenade and devstack both.

This is done by using PUBLIC_DEVICE_MTU devstack variable that will
guarantee the bridge is set appropriately in both devstack and grenade
cases.

Change-Id: I9bcc47303a6ce1f0b3125ad374adcc2e7ca654ac
Depends-On: I38a80bac18673a30842a7b997d0669fed5aff976
Related-Bug: #1603268
"}]
commit_message:
Always set br-ex mtu including for grenade runs

Previously we were only setting the mtu on br-ex if not running grenade.
But now neutron runs multinode grenade tests so need to have br-ex's mtu
set appropriately for grenade and devstack both.

This is done by using PUBLIC_DEVICE_MTU devstack variable that will
guarantee the bridge is set appropriately in both devstack and grenade
cases.

Change-Id: I9bcc47303a6ce1f0b3125ad374adcc2e7ca654ac
Depends-On: I38a80bac18673a30842a7b997d0669fed5aff976
Related-Bug: #1603268

commit_message:
Handle 404 responses from neutron when polling for floating IPs

Neutron may respond with a 404 error when polled for floating IPs when
the L3 service plugin is not installed. This was handled in
get_floating_ip method, but not in the other methods. This patch adds
code to handle it also inside get_floating_ips_by_address and
get_floating_ips_by_project.

Change-Id: Iddf1c4cbf99b55b231745ae7a1186ac519c56b94
Closes-bug: #1488537

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-03-07 18:31:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_flavor_manage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavor_manage.py', 'nova/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavor_rxtx.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavorextradata.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/flavors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavor_access.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/contrib/flavormanage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavor_swap.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/flavors.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/flavor_manage.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavor_disabled.py', 'nova/compute/api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_flavors.py'], 'message': 'Fix deleted non-public flavor lookups for non-admin users

This makes flavor lookups respect the "read_deleted" argument even
in non-admin contexts, by removing it as a constraint on the
relationship between the tables.  This should allow non-admin project
members to view details on deleted flavors when they are asking for
them, e.g., on running instances that were booted against flavors
that were subsequently deleted/edited.

It also adds an explicit flavor access check on lookups to ensure
that the requesting user has currently valid access to the flavor.
This will prevent users from booting/resizing instances onto flavors
where they previously had permissions, but no longer do.

Closes-Bug: 1366168
Change-Id: I14a9b20bb8d78d77d44c077805cdb6dec8436582
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deleted non-public flavor lookups for non-admin users

This makes flavor lookups respect the "read_deleted" argument even
in non-admin contexts, by removing it as a constraint on the
relationship between the tables.  This should allow non-admin project
members to view details on deleted flavors when they are asking for
them, e.g., on running instances that were booted against flavors
that were subsequently deleted/edited.

It also adds an explicit flavor access check on lookups to ensure
that the requesting user has currently valid access to the flavor.
This will prevent users from booting/resizing instances onto flavors
where they previously had permissions, but no longer do.

Closes-Bug: 1366168
Change-Id: I14a9b20bb8d78d77d44c077805cdb6dec8436582

Add a pep8 test to check that no code in the libvirt driver does any
direct XML parsing. nova.virt.libvirt.config classes should be used.

This test will fail until all existing occurences of direct XML

commit_message:
No direct XML parsing in libvirt driver

Add a pep8 test to check that no code in the libvirt driver does any
direct XML parsing. nova.virt.libvirt.config classes should be used.

This test will fail until all existing occurences of direct XML
parsing are replaced with corresponding config classes. This patch is
therefore WIP until if and when such changes are made.

Change-Id: I69ed148aa46441c2ae769b80ae7154be5933371b

commit_message:
[WIP] use neutron ironic port mapping

This is a prototype implementation on the nova ironic driver side for
the proposed neutron-ironic port mapping function. Basically it does
the following:

-- Simplifys the mac assignment process. A NIC's mac address is
determined by the port mapping function

-- supports portgroups, and it prefers ironic portgroup over ironic
port when mapping a neutron port.

-- Generates the instance's configdrive with the support of
network_data.json. In addition, vlan links are supported in the
network_data.json file.

Related-Bug: 1552364

Change-Id: Ie3ef45ac4670327229d73f88b40afec1dc4a455a

[{'number': 40, 'created': '2016-03-01 18:12:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/pci_device.py', 'nova/pci/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_stats.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_manager.py', 'nova/pci/stats.py'], 'message': 'Move logic of pci consume_requests to manager

Move logic from nova.pci.stats.PciDeviceStats.consume_requests()
to the nova.pci.manager.PciDevTracker._claim_for_instance() method
using pci devices instead of pci pools.
Add PciDevTracker.get_free_devs() method which returns list of
available pci devices.
Remove consume_requests method from PciDeviceStats class

This change is a second step to move from PciDeviceStats
implementation of the logic related to pci resources claim. After
this patch all the functionality will be transfered from PciDeviceStats
class to PciDevTracker and PciDevicePoolList classes. Migration to
non-PciDeviceStats implementation will make us free from the bugs related
to pci data sync between pci device table and PciDeviceStats objects.
Also it will make us be able to represent all system resources in a

Change-Id: I71cf7526286e2b1140804e7aeac93c11dd8b7583
Implements: blueprint pci-stats-generate
'}]
commit_message:
Move logic of pci consume_requests to manager

Move logic from nova.pci.stats.PciDeviceStats.consume_requests()
to the nova.pci.manager.PciDevTracker._claim_for_instance() method
using pci devices instead of pci pools.
Add PciDevTracker.get_free_devs() method which returns list of
available pci devices.
Remove consume_requests method from PciDeviceStats class

This change is a second step to move from PciDeviceStats
implementation of the logic related to pci resources claim. After
this patch all the functionality will be transfered from PciDeviceStats
class to PciDevTracker and PciDevicePoolList classes. Migration to
non-PciDeviceStats implementation will make us free from the bugs related
to pci data sync between pci device table and PciDeviceStats objects.
Also it will make us be able to represent all system resources in a
consistent way.

Change-Id: I71cf7526286e2b1140804e7aeac93c11dd8b7583
Implements: blueprint pci-stats-generate

commit_message:
XenAPI: create vdistore to stream vhd files

It uses xapi plugin running in dom0 to download image for vdi
creation in current implement. It requires additional disk space
in dom0 to hold the downloaded image. Now we can use the stream
in compute node to download image fram glance and stream data to
XAPI service; and also we can use stream to upload vhd to glance
to create new image.

Change-Id: Id7c96551f369981f023842cd4e10d005cb0e190f

commit_message:
Moved live_migration_cleanup_flags to driver class

live_migration_cleanup_flags method was located in compute
manager class, while operation libvirt specific migrate_data
attributes. It could cause problems in other drivers, because
they doesn't invoke drivers cleanup method properly.

Closes-bug: #1487477
Closes-bug: #1542415

Change-Id: Ie0843fbd2edfcb77bb6036697adc297997a9af4f

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-29 01:17:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Add expected_task_state for instance.save() used by block_device_mapping

When an instance was asked to be delete during it is
launching, we observed that the vm_state and
task_state of that instance has changed abnormally
like this:

When we delete the instance while its' task state
is networking:
scheduling->none->（networking）->deleting->
block_device_mapping-->spawing-->none

The expected task_state should be:
networking->deleting->deleted

and the vm_state changes like this:
BUILD-ACTIVE-disappear ,
which is also very strange for user.

This is due to the instance.save()
used by block_device_mapping doesn't
contain expected_task_state, it will
overwrite the DELETING task_state.

This patch adds expected_task_state
for instance.save() used by
block_device_mapping, by doing this,
the task_state of deleting will not
be overwritted again.

Change-Id: Ic002fef0875d98cec4f0779b4cd0b47849de1882
Closes-bug: #1512563
"}]
commit_message:
Add expected_task_state for instance.save() used by block_device_mapping

When an instance was asked to be delete during it is
launching, we observed that the vm_state and
task_state of that instance has changed abnormally
like this:

When we delete the instance while its' task state
is networking:
scheduling->none->（networking）->deleting->
block_device_mapping-->spawing-->none

The expected task_state should be:
networking->deleting->deleted

and the vm_state changes like this:
BUILD-ACTIVE-disappear ,
which is also very strange for user.

This is due to the instance.save()
used by block_device_mapping doesn't
contain expected_task_state, it will
overwrite the DELETING task_state.

This patch adds expected_task_state
for instance.save() used by
block_device_mapping, by doing this,
the task_state of deleting will not
be overwritted again.

Change-Id: Ic002fef0875d98cec4f0779b4cd0b47849de1882
Closes-bug: #1512563

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-05 17:45:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't reschedule if instance deleted.

On the compute node, if we want to do a retry we should check that
the instance.task_state matches one of the expected values.

In particular, there's no point in rescheduling an instance that
the user has requested be deleted.  (In which case the task_state
will be set to DELETING.)

Change-Id: I815a3eaf28c0fd508ae95884efeb0396a0af5475
Closes-Bug: #1542039
"}]
commit_message:
Don't reschedule if instance deleted.

On the compute node, if we want to do a retry we should check that
the instance.task_state matches one of the expected values.

In particular, there's no point in rescheduling an instance that
the user has requested be deleted.  (In which case the task_state
will be set to DELETING.)

Change-Id: I815a3eaf28c0fd508ae95884efeb0396a0af5475
Closes-Bug: #1542039

commit_message:
Add PciDevicePoolList.get_all method

This method executes subquery on pci_devices table and returns PciDevicePoolList containing all pci devices. It will be used by HostManager to get pci device info.

Add PciDevicePool _from_db_object method.

Change-Id: I9bec9f5f900a4f0f730b834aab4b71f21d68e686
Implements: blueprint pci-stats-generate

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

Partial-Bug: #1259292
Change-Id: I7e4e1130314bde16b384c53750f56312b1816c83

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-10-20 15:00:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_exception.py'], 'message': "Search for more keys when clearing passwords

Originally, when cleansing dicts of passwords, it just searched through
the keys, eliminating all that contained '_pass'. This allowed secrets
such as admin_token and adminPass to get through. oslo_utils.strutils
has a set of keys that it searches for in strings when masking
passwords. This set of keys is copied over to nova, and now all keys
within this set (along with keys containing '_pass' to retain original
functionality) are also eliminated from dicts.

Change-Id: I4bfba1f54f8f9b5ce65c6677b8e58f1e0b09c403
Closes-Bug: #1487038
"}]
commit_message:
Search for more keys when clearing passwords

Originally, when cleansing dicts of passwords, it just searched through
the keys, eliminating all that contained '_pass'. This allowed secrets
such as admin_token and adminPass to get through. oslo_utils.strutils
has a set of keys that it searches for in strings when masking
passwords. This set of keys is copied over to nova, and now all keys
within this set (along with keys containing '_pass' to retain original
functionality) are also eliminated from dicts.

Change-Id: I4bfba1f54f8f9b5ce65c6677b8e58f1e0b09c403
Closes-Bug: #1487038

commit_message:
Set XenAPI-specific swap and ephemeral device_name

Implements a XenAPI-specific block device naming scheme in that
explicitly names swap and ephemeral block devices (and leverages the
default naming scheme for remaining block devices) that matches the
XenAPI device assignment scheme.

After a recent change block device mappings are explicitly added for a
flavor's swap and ephemeral devices, but the default block device
naming scheme did not match XenAPI's block device assignment scheme
and was therefor creating incorrect bdm entries that were consuming
unused devices names.

Change-Id: I2b3c4525428361ef91e145c9c393b25aa70fb3ed
Closes-Bug: 1482403

subject: Xenapi: Mount Configdrive with proper vbd type
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6735, 'name': 'Bob Ball', 'email': 'bob.ball@citrix.com', 'username': 'bob-ball'}, {'_account_id': 8871, 'name': 'Elastic Recheck', 'username': 'elasticrecheck'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16148, 'name': 'Brooks Kaminski', 'username': 'bhkaminski', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-30 08:44:38.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/xenapi/vm_utils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/xenapi/test_vm_utils.py'], 'message': "Xenapi: Mount Configdrive with proper vbd type

Currently within nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils generate-configdrive
generates a VBD for the configdrive as vbd_type 'Disk', however the
data itself is created with an ISO9660(CDFS) filesystem.  This issue
does not currently cause any impact within *nix operating systems as
the disk recognition and mounting abilities seem quite lenient, however
this does cause issues within a Windows DomU.

When attached to a Windows DomU the disk is not recognized in any way
within the OS layer, whether this be through powershell or the standard
GUI methods (such as Disk Management).  Reading nova.conf to determine
the proper VBD type for the environment corrects this,  and is still
compatible with cloud-init configurations on both *nix and Windows.

This issue was addressed for libvirt within commit
'7f4b5771633f519a54aae985ae526418114b1a29' and as such I have made the
code look as similar as possible to maintain continuity.  This includes
the new method and tests to pull the Nova config drive type desired
from nova.conf.

Change-Id: I826f4280d63a34967ab37a2898a0a3db98d5285b
Closes-Bug: 1490238
"}]
commit_message:
Xenapi: Mount Configdrive with proper vbd type

Currently within nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils generate-configdrive
generates a VBD for the configdrive as vbd_type 'Disk', however the
data itself is created with an ISO9660(CDFS) filesystem.  This issue
does not currently cause any impact within *nix operating systems as
the disk recognition and mounting abilities seem quite lenient, however
this does cause issues within a Windows DomU.

When attached to a Windows DomU the disk is not recognized in any way
within the OS layer, whether this be through powershell or the standard
GUI methods (such as Disk Management).  Reading nova.conf to determine
the proper VBD type for the environment corrects this,  and is still
compatible with cloud-init configurations on both *nix and Windows.

This issue was addressed for libvirt within commit
'7f4b5771633f519a54aae985ae526418114b1a29' and as such I have made the
code look as similar as possible to maintain continuity.  This includes
the new method and tests to pull the Nova config drive type desired
from nova.conf.

Change-Id: I826f4280d63a34967ab37a2898a0a3db98d5285b
Closes-Bug: 1490238

subject: Use zuul-cloner for install-guide and api-* docs jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-18 14:31:27.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/api-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/manuals-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Use zuul-cloner for install-guide and api-* docs jobs

Use zuul-cloner with constraints set up for the project specific
install-guide and api-* docs jobs, so that projects can use constraints
and do not need a special install_command in their tox.ini for these.

Change-Id: I8f45a53429b9fcbf3689a268f096afdf5f32f461
'}]
commit_message:
Use zuul-cloner for install-guide and api-* docs jobs

Use zuul-cloner with constraints set up for the project specific
install-guide and api-* docs jobs, so that projects can use constraints
and do not need a special install_command in their tox.ini for these.

Change-Id: I8f45a53429b9fcbf3689a268f096afdf5f32f461

I've also removed the object primative in get_instance_diagnostics.

Some image types are converted while they are cached in the vSphere
datastore, which changes their size.  Therefore we can't rely on the
the size that Glance provides us in the meta data.  This fix
introduces another callback which updates the images size for image
types that are known to be converted.

This has been addressed in I18628fe3a180f722936c680c6be30d5ed4d50bd9
but that fix was incomplete, as it only handled sparse images.

Related-Bug: #1240373
Related-Bug: #1472955
Change-Id: I9ec344e25fef940b488ac7139fa0e7db882bea48
"}]
commit_message:
Update the image size according to datastore

Some image types are converted while they are cached in the vSphere
datastore, which changes their size.  Therefore we can't rely on the
the size that Glance provides us in the meta data.  This fix
introduces another callback which updates the images size for image
types that are known to be converted.

This has been addressed in I18628fe3a180f722936c680c6be30d5ed4d50bd9
but that fix was incomplete, as it only handled sparse images.

Related-Bug: #1240373
Related-Bug: #1472955
Change-Id: I9ec344e25fef940b488ac7139fa0e7db882bea48

commit_message:
Use bundletester for amulet test execution

Switch to using bundletester for execution of functional tests,
leveraging tox to build out test virtualenvs.

Rename amulet tests inline with gate-* and dfs-* naming standards.

Update README to refer to functional testing section of the charm
guide.

Change-Id: I60befab62843fa439a6a1fc897851091e4d47d49

commit_message:
Use bundletester for amulet test execution

Switch to using bundletester for execution of functional tests,
leveraging tox to build out test virtualenvs.

Rename amulet tests inline with gate-* and dfs-* naming standards.

Update README to refer to functional testing section of the charm
guide.

Change-Id: Id353b3a1c8a74d8b2bed7fe0490090b5273e228f

subject: Fix ceilometer auth url on undercloud
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 14:48:38.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Fix ceilometer auth url on undercloud

Due to a recent change introduced in puppet ceilometer[1]
ceilometer auth type defaults to password type and v2
auth_url doesnt work with domain. This fixes the url to
not include suffix.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320454/

Change-Id: I6064d152cbfeebdc5ac1fd570daf91cd55097754
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceilometer auth url on undercloud

Due to a recent change introduced in puppet ceilometer[1]
ceilometer auth type defaults to password type and v2
auth_url doesnt work with domain. This fixes the url to
not include suffix.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/320454/

Change-Id: I6064d152cbfeebdc5ac1fd570daf91cd55097754

User need to remove host from host aggregate, before removing the compute

commit_message:
Refuse to delete compute service if host is in host aggregate

User need to remove host from host aggregate, before removing the compute
service. Otherwise, host aggreate will deny to remove this host, because
compute service does not exist. And user will not able to delete this host
aggregate either, because it is not empty. This code change prevents user to
remove a compute service, before removing its host from host aggregate.

Change-Id: I8932737291d52c52b649a641dabe80fe443e028f
Closes-Bug: 1470341

commit_message:
Add support for using Ironic's node name as the hostname of the instance

This patch adds a new configuration option called "use_node_name_as_hostname"
in the [ironic] group which adds support for using the Ironic node's name
as the hostname for the instances being deployed by the Ironic driver.
This comes handy for people managing a lot of bare metal servers and
using the Ironic's name field to contain information about rack
location, rack number, node number etc...

Closes-Bug: #1508970
Change-Id: I1492edfe9c3bcb4daa6f447e0689ef2f5ff1cb37

commit_message:
Remove mox from tests/unit/objects/test_quotas.py

In test_commit_none_reservations and test_rollback_none_reservations, we
were previously not checking that the call wasn't made to
Quotas.commit() or Quotas.rollback() methods of objects/quotas.py.
Added an assert for the same now.

part of bp:remove-mox

Change-Id: I38f3ddb9fd394b5e717ab26727fa5847d5ca5a53

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-22 08:24:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_claims.py', 'nova/claims.py', 'nova/compute/claims.py', 'nova/scheduler/claims.py'], 'message': 'Correct MoveClaim in getting pci requests

Correct MoveClaim to get pci_requests from
`objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance_uuid_and_newness()`
according to the discussion in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262939/3/nova/compute/claims.py L351

MoveClaim should use a same set of pci requests to claim numa topology
and pci devices. And _test_pci() can be refactored because MoveClaim is
changed to test pci in a consistent way with SchedulerClaim and
ComputeClaim.

This is a separate patch to refactor claim code because it needs to
change(correct) the claim behavior of compute service. The behavior
changes are tested in unit tests.

Change-Id: I57b783bae94a29b59ce80c8c60bf2820fd138d38
Related to blueprint host-state-level-locking
'}]
commit_message:
Correct MoveClaim in getting pci requests

Correct MoveClaim to get pci_requests from
`objects.InstancePCIRequests.get_by_instance_uuid_and_newness()`
according to the discussion in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/262939/3/nova/compute/claims.py L351

MoveClaim should use a same set of pci requests to claim numa topology
and pci devices. And _test_pci() can be refactored because MoveClaim is
changed to test pci in a consistent way with SchedulerClaim and
ComputeClaim.

This is a separate patch to refactor claim code because it needs to
change(correct) the claim behavior of compute service. The behavior
changes are tested in unit tests.

Change-Id: I57b783bae94a29b59ce80c8c60bf2820fd138d38
Related to blueprint host-state-level-locking

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-12-21 08:46:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Sync vms az with the host when using aggregate

The AZ for vms on one host should be the same as the host or none,
when using aggregate, the AZ of the host can be changed between the default
and the AZ of the aggregate, at this time, we should sysc the AZ for all the
vms on this host to be consistent.
For example, vm1 is booted with specified available zone AZ1, and it is scheduled
to host A, which is belonging to AZ1 too, then remove host A from AZ1 and add it to
AZ2 by using aggregate-remove-host and aggregate-add-host, at this time, available
zone for vm1 is AZ1, but the vm is located at a host belonging to AZ2, that is
conflict, and we should sync the az of the vm with the host.

Closes-Bug: #1444841
Change-Id: Ic220caab1a45f12a679e97929628b604487629a9
'}]
commit_message:
Sync vms az with the host when using aggregate

The AZ for vms on one host should be the same as the host or none,
when using aggregate, the AZ of the host can be changed between the default
and the AZ of the aggregate, at this time, we should sysc the AZ for all the
vms on this host to be consistent.
For example, vm1 is booted with specified available zone AZ1, and it is scheduled
to host A, which is belonging to AZ1 too, then remove host A from AZ1 and add it to
AZ2 by using aggregate-remove-host and aggregate-add-host, at this time, available
zone for vm1 is AZ1, but the vm is located at a host belonging to AZ2, that is
conflict, and we should sync the az of the vm with the host.

Closes-Bug: #1444841
Change-Id: Ic220caab1a45f12a679e97929628b604487629a9

commit_message:
Make use of new Console and ConsolePool objects

This change replace direct db calls in nova/console code with calls
that use the newly introduced Console and ConsolePools objects.

This includes:
* removing the unused db.console_get_by_pool_instance
* converting from [] to regular object attribute calls

Related to blueprint mitaka-objects

Change-Id: Iad5468deaf15fc5c1298b892b50362b3a9c390e0

commit_message:
Update executor to eventlet

Default 'blocking' executor handles only one message at once.
'eventlet' executor is recommended.

Change-Id: Id738d0462fbb3c7fd6c78ee2f0dd0f1e79131ca7
Closes-Bug: #1517843

The "Invalid format for name: '%s'" message returned when creating
a server group doesn't describe the rules for a valid name.
I changed the message to match the current regex for a valid
name.  I also did some refactoring so that the 2 modules
checking for valid names are calling a common function
to get the error message.  This will avoid returning an
old message if the regex changes.

Change-Id: Id61f1750f9ae31eecbc2edbd96e3533ea62eb20e
Closes-bug: 1431932
'}]
commit_message:
Make the server group invalid format message more verbose

The "Invalid format for name: '%s'" message returned when creating
a server group doesn't describe the rules for a valid name.
I changed the message to match the current regex for a valid
name.  I also did some refactoring so that the 2 modules
checking for valid names are calling a common function
to get the error message.  This will avoid returning an
old message if the regex changes.

Change-Id: Id61f1750f9ae31eecbc2edbd96e3533ea62eb20e
Closes-bug: 1431932

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: do not run upgrade on fresh install

This avoids creating the full table of the old Ceilometer alarms stuff on fresh
install, while upgrade will just ignore them.

Change-Id: I06f825d9a65da46fb7c30fd07c706ee018098b83

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-25 07:42:43.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "sqlalchemy: fix JSONEncodedDict implementation type

It's actually Text, not String, as correctly written in migration

This fixes an error on MySQL as String is converted to VARCHAR which

Change-Id: I5f5d7902c647ba0b7a214bca21d0df1cc96fc57c
"}]
commit_message:
sqlalchemy: fix JSONEncodedDict implementation type

It's actually Text, not String, as correctly written in migration
scripts.

This fixes an error on MySQL as String is converted to VARCHAR which
requires a length.

Change-Id: I5f5d7902c647ba0b7a214bca21d0df1cc96fc57c

subject: Add vercmp function
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 14:49:05.000000000', 'files': ['functions', 'tests/test_vercmp.sh', 'tests/unittest.sh'], 'message': 'Add vercmp function

The existing vercmp_numbers function only handles, as the name says,
numbers.  I noticed that "sort" has had a version sort for a long time
[1] and, rather than re-implement it badly, use this as a version of
vercmp that works a bit more naturally.

This is intended to be used in an "if" statement as in

  prog_ver=$(prog_ver --version | grep ...)
  if vercmp $prog_ver "<" 2.0; then
     ...
  fi

A test-case is added to test the basic features and some edge-cases.

[1] http://git.savannah.gnu.org/gitweb/?p=coreutils.git;a=commitdiff;h=4c9fae4e97d95a9f89d1399a8aeb03051f0fec96

Conflicts:
	tests/unittest.sh

Change-Id: Ie55283acdc40a095b80b2631a55310072883ad0d
(cherry picked from commit 2ba36cda7940d630514a7864132837191d8c561f)
'}]
commit_message:
Add vercmp function

The existing vercmp_numbers function only handles, as the name says,
numbers.  I noticed that "sort" has had a version sort for a long time
[1] and, rather than re-implement it badly, use this as a version of
vercmp that works a bit more naturally.

This is intended to be used in an "if" statement as in

  prog_ver=$(prog_ver --version | grep ...)
  if vercmp $prog_ver "<" 2.0; then
     ...
  fi

A test-case is added to test the basic features and some edge-cases.

[1] http://git.savannah.gnu.org/gitweb/?p=coreutils.git;a=commitdiff;h=4c9fae4e97d95a9f89d1399a8aeb03051f0fec96

Conflicts:
	tests/unittest.sh

Change-Id: Ie55283acdc40a095b80b2631a55310072883ad0d
(cherry picked from commit 2ba36cda7940d630514a7864132837191d8c561f)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-07-19 16:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['watcher/db/api.py'], 'message': "Remove unused columns parameters in watcher/db/api

In watcher/db/api.py, some abstract methods are specifying a 'columns'
parameter that is actually ignored in db/sqlalchemy/api.py. Since we
do not need this parameter, realignment was done for the signatures
of these methods, by removing the 'column' parameter (and its
docstring) from every single one of the following methods.

get_audit_template_list
get_audit_list
get_action_list
get_action_plan_list

Closes-Bug: #1597641
Change-Id: If706e24d5714f0139fd135bdc41d17d0e431e302
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unused columns parameters in watcher/db/api

In watcher/db/api.py, some abstract methods are specifying a 'columns'
parameter that is actually ignored in db/sqlalchemy/api.py. Since we
do not need this parameter, realignment was done for the signatures
of these methods, by removing the 'column' parameter (and its
docstring) from every single one of the following methods.

get_audit_template_list
get_audit_list
get_action_list
get_action_plan_list

Closes-Bug: #1597641
Change-Id: If706e24d5714f0139fd135bdc41d17d0e431e302

commit_message:
Switch HostState to use pci device pools

Change HostState to contain pci_device_pools attribute instead of
pci_stats. Pci passthrough and numa topology filters host_passes method
now checks pci device pools of the HostState instead of pci_stats.
Claim class was also changed to work with pci device pools while
claiming for pci devices.

This change will remove from us responsibility to look for sync between
pci devices in database and pci_stats view.

Change-Id: I5ef7cfb4ec05e677a136811a3a66d1fdaaaedf7b
Implements: blueprint pci-stats-generate

revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2016-02-24 16:26:24.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_host_manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Change HostManager to load pci_dev_pools from db

During initialization of HostState pci_device_pools is set to None.
In update_from_compute_node method of HostState pci_device_pools is no
longer updated from compute node.
During initialization of HostManager pci_device_pools for each compute
node is loaded from db using PciDevicePoolList.get_all() in case if
PciPassthroughFilter is enabled. Then for each host_state pci device
pools information is loaded from HostManager based on compute node id.

This fix will lead HostManager to use actual pci device pools data.

Change-Id: I259ee2a0031997ef63678a9a77b80ad11cd88360
Implements: blueprint pci-stats-generate
'}]
commit_message:
Change HostManager to load pci_dev_pools from db

During initialization of HostState pci_device_pools is set to None.
In update_from_compute_node method of HostState pci_device_pools is no
longer updated from compute node.
During initialization of HostManager pci_device_pools for each compute
node is loaded from db using PciDevicePoolList.get_all() in case if
PciPassthroughFilter is enabled. Then for each host_state pci device
pools information is loaded from HostManager based on compute node id.

This fix will lead HostManager to use actual pci device pools data.

Change-Id: I259ee2a0031997ef63678a9a77b80ad11cd88360
Implements: blueprint pci-stats-generate

commit_message:
WIP: Use state machines to manage the migraiton status field.

This patch adds a new status_machine field into class Migration.
This filed will be initialized when it is first used, and at this
time, "migration_type" and "status" fields should be initialized
first.

NOTE: The state machine has not been used in real migration code.
      And there is no test case for it. This is a WIP patch-set.

Change-Id: I77d7c0ec355204732d37d5b0211a3cc33185bbb8
Implements: blueprint migration-state-machine

commit_message:
scheduler: Adds HostCapabilitiesFilter filter

The mentioned filter will check the instance's image
metadata properties and flavor extra_specs for any
requested capabilities and checks whether the given
host is capable of satisfying the capabilities requested
by the instance.

Partially-Implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

Change-Id: Ia18f74bfdaee83f904d2d9653df79ce3397b1cac

commit_message:
API: Exposes host capabilities via the nova hypervisor API

Bumps nova API max microversion.
Adds 'host_capabilities' field to the result of the os-hypervisors/detail
and os-hypervisors/show nova APIs.
Adds API samples for the new microversion.
Adds unit and functional tests for the new microversion.

DocImpact

APIImpact

Change-Id: I06d4e5e9ba6398e6a4556a792fc4393ce940fa17
Partially-Implements: blueprint expose-host-capabilities

The method _rollback_live_migration() requires migrate_data to calculate
if it will do cleanup or destroy_disks.

In hyperv and xen, these drivers don't pass migrate_data to the
live migration recover method. So if live migration failed, the
instance's image will be deleted in cleanup action if the instance
is using shared block device like ceph rbd.

This patch also make migrate_data as required parameter in
_rollback_live_migration since all compute driver requires to pass it.

P.S. We can not just try to catch exception while driver do live_migration
since for libvirt driver it may call _rollback_live_migration itself
many times.

Closes-Bug: #1439609
Co-authored-by: Eli Qiao <liyong.qiao@intel.com>
Change-Id: If99af9f39eecbc44e9160fed564718715ffd8b84

commit_message:
Passing migrate_data to recover_method

The method _rollback_live_migration() requires migrate_data to calculate
if it will do cleanup or destroy_disks.

In hyperv and xen, these drivers don't pass migrate_data to the
live migration recover method. So if live migration failed, the
instance's image will be deleted in cleanup action if the instance
is using shared block device like ceph rbd.

This patch also make migrate_data as required parameter in
_rollback_live_migration since all compute driver requires to pass it.

P.S. We can not just try to catch exception while driver do live_migration
since for libvirt driver it may call _rollback_live_migration itself
many times.

Closes-Bug: #1439609
Co-authored-by: Eli Qiao <liyong.qiao@intel.com>
Change-Id: If99af9f39eecbc44e9160fed564718715ffd8b84

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-29 16:02:09.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/network/test_linux_net.py', 'nova/network/linux_net.py'], 'message': "network: Add external id on OVS port/interface for bridge lookup

The OVS schema doesn't have references back to the bridge that a
port or interface is on. When trying to get a list of interface
details that are confined to a particular bridge, the ovs-vsctl
command does not allow this to be done in a single transaction.
You first have to query the list of ports on a bridge, then do a
separate transaction pulling the details of the Interfaces that
are attached to those ports. Adding an external_id with the bridge
name makes it possible to do a single 'find' query to get the
details of every interface tagged with that bridge name.

This should have no upgrade concerns for Nova and the lack of
these external_ids will have to be handled only on the Neutron
side.

A POC patch implementing the neutron side of this change is here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203381/

Change-Id: Ibc24aa47454774a540f8bff7d608509926cc1947
"}]
commit_message:
network: Add external id on OVS port/interface for bridge lookup

The OVS schema doesn't have references back to the bridge that a
port or interface is on. When trying to get a list of interface
details that are confined to a particular bridge, the ovs-vsctl
command does not allow this to be done in a single transaction.
You first have to query the list of ports on a bridge, then do a
separate transaction pulling the details of the Interfaces that
are attached to those ports. Adding an external_id with the bridge
name makes it possible to do a single 'find' query to get the
details of every interface tagged with that bridge name.

This should have no upgrade concerns for Nova and the lack of
these external_ids will have to be handled only on the Neutron
side.

A POC patch implementing the neutron side of this change is here:
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/203381/

Change-Id: Ibc24aa47454774a540f8bff7d608509926cc1947

commit_message:
Following the hacking rule for string interpolation at logging

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled
by the logging code, rather than being done
at the point of the logging call.

See the oslo i18n guideline.

* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages

* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#avoid-forcing-the-translation-of-translatable-variables


Change-Id: I96eaede777ca60c7ba2b83ea6968108910b62953
Closes-Bug: #1596829

subject: Use freezegun to increment the clock in test_v3_filters
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-18 15:47:58.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_filters.py'], 'message': 'Use freezegun to increment the clock in test_v3_filters

In preparation for making Fernet the default token provider, we must freeze and
increment the clock in certain tests. This is because Fernet does not support
sub-second precision and if a Fernet token is validated in the same second that
a revocation event has occured, it will be considered invalid.

This commit makes it so that we freeze the clock in
test_list_users_filtered_by_funny_name() and increment it by one second when we
go to list users by name.

This fix was originally a part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258650 but
this is an attempt to break 258650 into smaller, more reviewable, pieces.

Partial-Bug: 1561054
Change-Id: I3ea4af702e6914775156c605799992a41e8e75c5
'}]
commit_message:
Use freezegun to increment the clock in test_v3_filters

In preparation for making Fernet the default token provider, we must freeze and
increment the clock in certain tests. This is because Fernet does not support
sub-second precision and if a Fernet token is validated in the same second that
a revocation event has occured, it will be considered invalid.

This commit makes it so that we freeze the clock in
test_list_users_filtered_by_funny_name() and increment it by one second when we
go to list users by name.

This fix was originally a part of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/258650 but
this is an attempt to break 258650 into smaller, more reviewable, pieces.

Partial-Bug: 1561054
Change-Id: I3ea4af702e6914775156c605799992a41e8e75c5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 04:48:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/devref/quota.rst', 'neutron/quota/resource.py', 'neutron/db/quota/driver.py'], 'message': "Use db_api.retry_db_errors in quota engine

The quota engine was still using oslo_db wrap_db_retry
which does not automatically take into account deadlocks
that occur inside of nested savepoint transactions.

In one case it didn't matter because it passed in the correct
exception checker but in the one that protected 'set_quota_usage'
it did not use is_retriable so a deadlock inside of the savepoint
would have resulted in a much more expensive retry all of the way
up at the API layer.

This patch just adjusts them to both use the standard neutron
retry_db_errors decorator.

Change-Id: I1e45eb15f14bf35881e5b1dce77733e831e9c6b1
Related-Bug: #1596075
"}]
commit_message:
Use db_api.retry_db_errors in quota engine

The quota engine was still using oslo_db wrap_db_retry
which does not automatically take into account deadlocks
that occur inside of nested savepoint transactions.

In one case it didn't matter because it passed in the correct
exception checker but in the one that protected 'set_quota_usage'
it did not use is_retriable so a deadlock inside of the savepoint
would have resulted in a much more expensive retry all of the way
up at the API layer.

This patch just adjusts them to both use the standard neutron
retry_db_errors decorator.

Change-Id: I1e45eb15f14bf35881e5b1dce77733e831e9c6b1
Related-Bug: #1596075

commit_message:
Handle SSL termination proxies for version list

Cinder list with pagination contains wrong scheme for
'next' link in case of SSL endpoints. This patch fixes
it and returns the correct scheme in version URLs if
service is behind an SSL termination proxy.

Change-Id: If5aab9cc25a2e7c66a0bb13b5f7488a667b30309
Closes-Bug: #1558683
(cherry picked from commit d7e7e7bdf0f112c8315ae38f04b4849338173d51)

commit_message:
Add 'test' extra-require to setup.py

For a purpose of testing external extension I need to install nailgun as
a library, but with extra testing requirements. This patch adds
`extras_require` section to setup.py with test dependencies.

Change-Id: I3c1836da184e410d4bfa32ca854d80356f62968b
(cherry picked from commit 9e601d5edb5c464f1154cfb6c70ab6e7c0a84a73)

commit_message:
Check deprecation status for cells.py

Remove deprecated opt 'manager' as it is shown as one of the
options to be deprecated in Mitaka per document below:
 http://docs.openstack.org/mitaka/config-reference/tables/conf-changes/nova.html.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-newton

Change-Id: I6e3690c8905e052a6bc9910511c2596b5848acb4

There is specific code in storwize_svc_common
get_host_from_connector to check for CMMVC5754E in
the exception coming back from lshost(), but the exception
type was ProcessExecutionError. I believe that was correct
at one point in the past, but it has been switched to be
exception.VolumeBackendAPIException now so this change looks
for that. Adds UT and other minor cleanup.

Change-Id: If3220e88ae191ca3b5ff0949212e2f23552de300
Closes-Bug: #1578294
'}]
commit_message:
Storwize: Fix exception ProcessExecutionError

There is specific code in storwize_svc_common
get_host_from_connector to check for CMMVC5754E in
the exception coming back from lshost(), but the exception
type was ProcessExecutionError. I believe that was correct
at one point in the past, but it has been switched to be
exception.VolumeBackendAPIException now so this change looks
for that. Adds UT and other minor cleanup.

Change-Id: If3220e88ae191ca3b5ff0949212e2f23552de300
Closes-Bug: #1578294

commit_message:
Add missing LOG variable to fix scenario tests

When https://review.openstack.org/#/c/307346/ was rebased
with https:/review.openstack.org/#/c/309682, the LOG variable
was inadvertently removed. This commit adds it back as the
missing variable is causing a failure in the scenario tests.

Change-Id: I53d25199314f916b82be8d52e99559aeb9c4f2b1
Closes-Bug: 1604131

subject: Reduce the OSIC max-servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-19 16:21:54.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Reduce the OSIC max-servers

The OSIC cloud1 environment is currently running out of IPv4 space.
We are working on getting more IPv4 addresses and potentially
adding IPv6 however that will take a bit more time. Reducing this
value will ensure we're not seeing so many errors in the OSIC
as nodepool allocates resources for the gate.

Change-Id: I9c5eb20d965010c140880b1b309871fad57d8782
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce the OSIC max-servers

The OSIC cloud1 environment is currently running out of IPv4 space.
We are working on getting more IPv4 addresses and potentially
adding IPv6 however that will take a bit more time. Reducing this
value will ensure we're not seeing so many errors in the OSIC
as nodepool allocates resources for the gate.

Change-Id: I9c5eb20d965010c140880b1b309871fad57d8782
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Revert "Release xstatic-mdi 1.6.50.1"

The process for releasing xstatic packages appears to be broken
currently (see https://pypi.python.org/pypi/XStatic-mdi) so we
should revert the commit until the process can be fixed.

This reverts commit b18ad556f173d99d3703c71fdd2e08b9e28b2815.

Change-Id: I3b3db55e90d789c1fb044cd30d8c418f797ec5b4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-03 03:24:48.000000000', 'files': ['nova/cells/scheduler.py'], 'message': "Add correct form 'pci_requests' objects in build instance request on child cell.

In function of _create_instances_here in nova/cell/scheduler.py, 'pci_requests' is discarded directly. Because the instance was
brutally serialized before being sent over RPC to child cell. Thus, the pci_requests value wasn't really sent in a useful form.
So in Kilo an Liberty, 'pci_requests' is discarded directly.

Fixes Bug1540764.

Change-Id: Ibf1a3e126804e0a49f4bf397a847ea563cce9d30
"}]
commit_message:
Add correct form 'pci_requests' objects in build instance request on child cell.

In function of _create_instances_here in nova/cell/scheduler.py, 'pci_requests' is discarded directly. Because the instance was
brutally serialized before being sent over RPC to child cell. Thus, the pci_requests value wasn't really sent in a useful form.
So in Kilo an Liberty, 'pci_requests' is discarded directly.

Fixes Bug1540764.

Change-Id: Ibf1a3e126804e0a49f4bf397a847ea563cce9d30

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 18:36:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_fixtures.py'], 'message': 'Add TriggerOnCall fixture

This adds a fixture that lets you mock/wrap a method and block until it
is called. This could be useful for functional tests where we kick off
an operation in another greenthread and wait for it to finish. Currently,
we do things like poll in a (pretty) tight loop, which wastes CPU
resources. This gives us a contextually-relevant wakeup to do our poll.

Change-Id: I0a8dbf73c01939bcdf9b43c8f8b954a78b03794e
'}]
commit_message:
Add TriggerOnCall fixture

This adds a fixture that lets you mock/wrap a method and block until it
is called. This could be useful for functional tests where we kick off
an operation in another greenthread and wait for it to finish. Currently,
we do things like poll in a (pretty) tight loop, which wastes CPU
resources. This gives us a contextually-relevant wakeup to do our poll.

Change-Id: I0a8dbf73c01939bcdf9b43c8f8b954a78b03794e

 \xa0\xa0 * def _prepare_image()

\xa0\xa0  * def use_image()
    * ...
3. Add subclasses of class Image:

commit_message:
VMware: Refactor fetching all kinds of images

Currently we use callbacks to prepare/fetch/cache image in VMware,
It is a bit difficult to understand(to me). To make it more structured
and improve the maintainability of the code, let's use class & abstract
methods instead. And the code will be more clean.

How to do it:
1. Add a base class Image;
2. Add abstract methods for class Image:
    * def _prepare_image()
    * def _cache_image()
    * def _fetch_image()
    * def use_image()
    * ...
3. Add subclasses of class Image:
    * class FlatImage
    * class IsoImage
    * class SparseImage
    * class StreamOptimizedImage
    * class OvaImage
   Then let each class implements the abstract method mentioned above.

Change-Id: I1a4774c79162c7ca2b09f3386aefa65c01926842

commit_message:
WIP: Eventually consistent host state prototype

This patch is a conceptual implementation of bp
eventually-consistent-scheduler-host-state to testify its design goals
in accuracy, performance, reliability and compatibility improvements.

To run and test this prototype, download this patch and set
`scheduler_host_manager=shared_host_manager` in "nova.conf". Do not
forget to update "nova/nova.egg-info/entry_points.txt" according to the
modified "setup.cfg". Also note: Multiple scheduler instances can only
run on separate machines, and this prototype supports filter schedulers
and caching schedulers running at the same time.

In order to be flexible with design changes and quick prototyping, there
are still no unit tests. They will be added once the general idea is
accepted and the design is confirmed with spec.

For discussions and detailed explanation, please refer to the maillist:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-February/086516.html

If you find any bugs, please paste your detailed log information to
http://paste.openstack.org/ and reply here.

Please refer to the summit session if you are interested:
https://www.openstack.org/summit/austin-2016/vote-for-speakers/Presentation/7316

Related to blueprint eventually-consistent-scheduler-host-state
Change-Id: I6432197c0c52a445f75d5d801fe8722e67da1aff

commit_message:
virt/libvirt: Consider live-resize limits when booting an instance

Retrieve live-resize limits for memory and vcpus from flavor and
set vcpu and maxMemory values in domain xml accordingly.

commit_message:
Implement images list default and maximum limit

Limit image listings the same as server and flavor listings, as the
documentation states [1], by modifying get_pagination_params(), so
that it actually does what its docstring states [2], and adjust
get_limit_and_marker() to account for the underlying change.

[1] "To reduce load on the service, list operations return a maximum
    number of items at a time. The maximum number of items returned is
    determined by the compute provider."
    http://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/v2/paginated_collections.html

[2] "If 'limit' is not specified, 0, or > max_limit, we default to
    max_limit."

Change-Id: I9bdb649362a5ad0c5fdb0f3836ad0991b1de9887

subject: NoVNC: Allow Origin header protocols on a per-host basis
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 23:55:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/console/websocketproxy.py', 'nova/tests/unit/console/test_websocketproxy.py'], 'message': "NoVNC: Allow Origin header protocols on a per-host basis

While `console_allowed_origins` allows for additional allowed `Origin`
header hosts, it doesn't allow the `Origin` header protocol to deviate
from the protocol in the published service URL.

`console_allowed_origin_protocols` specifies additional `Origin`
header protocols that are allowed on a per-host basis.

    [DEFAULT]
    console_allowed_origins = www.example.com,dev.example.com,localhost
    console_allowed_origin_protocols = localhost:http

This allows web developers to work on noVNC web interfaces served over
HTTP from their local computers which directs the web browser to a
noVNC proxy that uses HTTPS (while www.example.com and dev.example.com
must use the same protocol as the noVNC proxy, presumably HTTPS).

Change-Id: Id8d2ded9b4bd81f312c1b746e8ad719ed7a0644b
"}]
commit_message:
NoVNC: Allow Origin header protocols on a per-host basis

While `console_allowed_origins` allows for additional allowed `Origin`
header hosts, it doesn't allow the `Origin` header protocol to deviate
from the protocol in the published service URL.

`console_allowed_origin_protocols` specifies additional `Origin`
header protocols that are allowed on a per-host basis.

    [DEFAULT]
    console_allowed_origins = www.example.com,dev.example.com,localhost
    console_allowed_origin_protocols = localhost:http

This allows web developers to work on noVNC web interfaces served over
HTTP from their local computers which directs the web browser to a
noVNC proxy that uses HTTPS (while www.example.com and dev.example.com
must use the same protocol as the noVNC proxy, presumably HTTPS).

Change-Id: Id8d2ded9b4bd81f312c1b746e8ad719ed7a0644b

commit_message:
Compute: Check live-resize constraints

Check that live-resize constraints are met before resizing:
1.The maximum limit of resources in the target falavor is
less than current flavor.
2.Live resize of resources are allowed in image metadata.

Change-Id: I61b57887cdccf8b9673c47497f4a7f00a0b4fe61
Partially-Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

commit_message:
Libvirt: live-resize vcpus without NUMA

Perfrom live-resize of vcpus for guests without NUMA topolgy.
Memory live-resize will not be supported for guests without NUMA.
Disk live-resize will be implemented by a separate delivery.

Change-Id: Ieed6cd08ffb37067221ce61cf78feb422d7d22dc
Partially-Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

commit_message:
Libvirt: Add methods to parse domain metadata from xml

Add methods to parse the domain metadata from xml into LibvirtConfig
classes. This is needed to update the flavor information in the
domains metadata following a live-resize operation.

Change-Id: I9b6bead807052eccca8df0455ed0151f4f38a200
Partially-Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

commit_message:
objects: Adds os_live_resize field to ImageMetaProps

The image metadata property os_live_resize is a set of
live-resizable resources supported by the guest. It is
mandatory for the live-resize operation.

Change-Id: I90b8068452b9f555384eeb78e451aadd2ebab0e4
Partially-Implements: blueprint instance-live-resize

commit_message:
Allows to set display_name as instance_name

This patch adds option in nova.conf to ignore the
user input for instance name and set the display_name
same as the instance_name. It also add the relevant
code to set instance display_name to instance_name.

Implements: blueprint instance-display-name

Change-Id: I563af3e790aa2b9cbbf9c265ce1bbe48106c0708

Add a new job to run when a patch merges in openstack/releases to apply

commit_message:
add job to apply tags when based on changes in openstack/releases

Add a new job to run when a patch merges in openstack/releases to apply
the tags described in the patch. For now, only apply those tags to the
openstack/release-test repository so we can test the job. A later patch
will remove that restriction so the job can apply the tags to all
repositories.

Change-Id: I2121781197d3ed824fed91cdebd0ee9ebeb353d2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Replace deprecated LOG.warn with LOG.warning

LOG.warn is deprecated. It is still used in few modules.
Replaced with non-deprecated LOG.warning.

Change-Id: If18dfd975eb5977f0ac249c3386ebd242d4e0ecc
Partial-Bug: #1508442

commit_message:
Nested Quota Driver

Nested Quota Driver patch adds hierarchical support. Quota
API's now can also handle hierarchical projects.

For the first pass only a user with admin role in a parent project
will be able to update and delete its children quotas.

Even after these changes are made, the existing DbQuotaDriver
functionalities will remain unchanged. The same driver will be able to
handle flat projects as well as hierarchical projects.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>

Partially Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

Change-Id: I18ce5dce266bfc0fd6d3019dc572bf82d6e02cdc

Add a microversion to allow the delete_on_termination attribute of a

commit_message:
WIP Allow modification of delete_on_termination

Add a microversion to allow the delete_on_termination attribute of a
volume attachment (block device mapping) to be updated by the
os-volume_attachments API.

The current implementation of the update action allows the user to
swap which volume is attached on a volume attachment.  This change
allows the user to set the delete_on_termination value, swap the
volume, or both.

Related to blueprint delete-on-termination-modification
APIImpact

Change-Id: I92b9c337604b7d5ec1cdea143f7ccd2914513724

commit_message:
Cells RAM/IP combined weigher

This introduces a weigher that takes both RAM and IP availability in a
cell into account. It bases the resulting weight on the limiting factor
of the two. Decrementing is also used to approximate results in case
there is a burst of builds between multiple schedulers. Further, the
maximum number of builds a cell can support based on max IO ops and max
instances is accounted for.

Implements: blueprint cells-concurrent-builds

Change-Id: Ifec5f36db6991e74540e362a3ee8f54c7d9cea0a

commit_message:
Listing volumes does not provide a link to next element

When GETting os-volumes, the returned list of volumes respects the
osapi_max_limit configuration parameter but does not provide a link to
the next element in the list.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint add-resources-links
Change-Id: Id14a87a8fefab0b7a403385808d6a19553b37db3
Closes-Bug: 1504641

commit_message:
Add sriov info for live migration

This patch tries to add sriov mechanism to the live
migration with following points:
 - generate sriov info in the pre_live_migration logic
 - update the sriov xml during the live migration executing

Change-Id: I78fbcbdcd2a0cb53aa1f12a25de2a1d20c003ac2
Implements: blueprint sriov-live-migration

commit_message:
Add checking logic for sriov migration

Currently, only macvtap migration will be supported,
so we will raise exception if there are some direct
sriov ports attached on the instance and then terminate
the migration operation.

Change-Id: I155a952e942f8b234797063043d29ce4e49c36b4

commit_message:
Nested Quota: Set default values to subproject

In case of hierarchical projects set the default value
(for resources who have the resource flag set) for a
sub-project to zero. This patch adds this functionality for
hierarchical projects, while keeping the functionality
intact for non-hierarchical project. At the top level,
project resources will get the default values as imposed
by the "default" class settings.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>

Partially Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

Change-Id: I326a81957ef78f85ba35345b4c64fae456ad5ffc

commit_message:
Make the create_instance call accept security group ids as well as names

Since it's possible to have multiple security groups with the same name,
we need a way of specifying the groups by id instead. This change makes
it still accept names (for backward compatibility), but treats them as
ids when they are simple numbers.

Change-Id: I0025893535837ebcd53e9fdcc7dc71c509fe0988
Closes-bug: #1289195

commit_message:
Ensure _cleanup_deploy is called even if _unprovision raises

This change ensures that _cleanup_deploy gets called, even in the face
of _unprovision raising an exception. Solves a bug where ironic's virt
driver neglects to delete an instance's ID in ironic, even though nova expects
the instance to be cleared in ironic.

Change-Id: I8d61fe4200aa826c29b7b144c9f7e892c519f6df

commit_message:
tox: add py35 envs for convenience

py35 jobs are going to be run in the gate soon. Add py35 to the list
of defaut envs and add corresponding pifpaf environments for running
tests locally.

All py35 tests currently pass - we can effectively declare py35
compatibility via a new classifier in setup.cfg.

Change-Id: Iea7e286062f95d5c61b9ec1e7f6af4138fe3ce99

subject: Make os-net-config idempotent with Linux bonds and MAC mapping
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-30 23:02:13.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/utils.py'], 'message': "Make os-net-config idempotent with Linux bonds and MAC mapping

This small change fixes a serious bug in os-net-config which made
mapping NICs by MAC address not idempotent if Linux bonds were used.

The first time os-net-config runs, it sees the MAC address of each
interface, then it sets up the bond. On subsequent runs, any
non-primary interfaces have taken the MAC address of the primary
interface in the bond. At this time, they all show the same MAC
address. This causes the mapping to fail, and it appears that
the system has fewer matching interfaces than it had before.

The impact of this bug is that bonding doesn't work for
anyone doing mapping by MAC address. This is known to be affecting
installations with a particular 3rd-party Neutron plugin vendor.

This change simply looks for the permanent hardware address under
the bonding_slave directory, if it exists.

Change-Id: I5b0087370f74ecc319d2285b0f9f5f3dd951dbc2
"}]
commit_message:
Make os-net-config idempotent with Linux bonds and MAC mapping

This small change fixes a serious bug in os-net-config which made
mapping NICs by MAC address not idempotent if Linux bonds were used.

The first time os-net-config runs, it sees the MAC address of each
interface, then it sets up the bond. On subsequent runs, any
non-primary interfaces have taken the MAC address of the primary
interface in the bond. At this time, they all show the same MAC
address. This causes the mapping to fail, and it appears that
the system has fewer matching interfaces than it had before.

The impact of this bug is that bonding doesn't work for
anyone doing mapping by MAC address. This is known to be affecting
installations with a particular 3rd-party Neutron plugin vendor.

This change simply looks for the permanent hardware address under
the bonding_slave directory, if it exists.

Change-Id: I5b0087370f74ecc319d2285b0f9f5f3dd951dbc2

commit_message:
PoC: Understandable weighers

Make the weighers more unserstandable for operators and easier to
deploy. A new weigher and placement algorithm that is easier to
understand in operation and has far fewer configuraion options while
still making good placment decisions.

Change-Id: If4fee90541f15e7286e6daefb14b8021bb1ac8e4

There are differences between requestslib's PreparedRequest and
Syntribos' RequestObject, which can cause problems when they are used

This is a first pass at a fix, editing BaseTestCase's send_init_request

commit_message:
First pass at fix for bug #1604187

There are differences between requestslib's PreparedRequest and
Syntribos' RequestObject, which can cause problems when they are used
inconsistently.

This is a first pass at a fix, editing BaseTestCase's send_init_request
to add the body to the test.init_req object.

Change-Id: I6f71fb52bca2f1cccdbdbce5f081431a0750db66
Partial-Bug: #1604187
